Requirement Description: Project objectives are clearly defined and approved
Legal / Regulatory Justification (Exact: AI systems should serve as a tool for people, with the ultimate aim of increasing human well-being.
This Regulation should be applied in accordance with the values of the Union enshrined as in the Charter.
To obtain the greatest benefits from AI systems while protecting fundamental rights, health and safety.
This Regulation aims to foster the development, use and uptake of AI in the internal market.
A clearly defined risk-based approach should be followed.
Impact analysis
column10: AI may generate risks and cause harm to public interests and fundamental rights.

Legal / Regulatory Justification (Exact: A high level of protection of health and safety and fundamental rights should be ensured.

Requirement Description: Regulatory or compliance impact is identified
Legal / Regulatory Justification (Exact: Harmonised rules applicable to the placing on the market, the putting into service and the use of AI systems should be laid down.
AI systems are developed and used in accordance with privacy and data protection rules.
Obligations placed on various operators involved in the AI value chain under this Regulation should apply.

Requirement Description: Project manager is assigned with clear authority
Legal / Regulatory Justification (Exact: Uniform obligations for operators and deployers should be ensured.
Governance model
column9: This Regulation should ensure effective implementation and enforcement.

Legal / Regulatory Justification (Exact: A consistent and high level of protection throughout the Union should be ensured.

Requirement Description: Project scope is clearly defined and approved
Legal / Regulatory Justification (Exact: The intended purpose of the AI system should be clearly defined.
The objectives of the AI system may be different from the intended purpose in a specific context.
AI systems may change while in use and should remain compliant.
Compliance should be ensured throughout the lifecycle of the AI system.

Requirement Description: Project plan and milestones are approved
Legal / Regulatory Justification (Exact: Providers and deployers should ensure compliance before placing on the market or putting into service.

Requirement Description: Timeline is realistic and agreed by stakeholders
Legal / Regulatory Justification (Exact: Measures should be proportionate and effective.

Requirement Description: Resource needs are identified and approved
Legal / Regulatory Justification (Exact: Appropriate measures should be taken to ensure compliance.
This Regulation should support innovation while ensuring protection of public interests.

Requirement Description: Project risks are identified and documented
Legal / Regulatory Justification (Exact: High-risk AI systems should only be placed on the market if they comply with certain mandatory requirements.
Obligations for operators involved in the AI value chain should apply.

Requirement Description: Mitigation plans exist for high risks
Legal / Regulatory Justification (Exact: Risks and harm to fundamental rights should be prevented or minimised.
Compliance should be ensured on a continuous basis.
Affected persons should be protected from harmful effects of AI systems.
Transparency obligations should apply to certain AI systems.
Effective enforcement and oversight should be ensured.

Requirement Description: Escalation process is defined and known
Legal / Regulatory Justification (Exact: Appropriate governance mechanisms should be in place.
AI systems should be technically robust and safe.

Requirement Description: Acceptance and sign-off criteria are defined
Legal / Regulatory Justification (Exact: AI systems should allow appropriate human oversight.

Requirement Description: Formal acceptance is required at key milestones
Legal / Regulatory Justification (Exact: Human oversight should be ensured throughout use.
Measures should be proportionate to the risks involved.
Appropriate follow-up actions should be taken.
Effective governance and accountability should be ensured.
AI systems should not pose unacceptable risks to health, safety or fundamental rights.

Requirement Description: Operational ownership is formally handed over
Legal / Regulatory Justification (Exact: Deployers should ensure compliant use of AI systems.
Compliance obligations apply throughout the lifecycle.

Requirement Description: Lessons learned are documented and shared
Legal / Regulatory Justification (Exact: This Regulation supports continuous improvement and trustworthy AI.
